Results.Name: Ensure that the --anonymous-auth argument is set to false
Results.Description: Disable anonymous requests to the API server

Results.Name: Ensure that the --token-auth-file parameter is not set
Results.Description: Do not use token based authentication

Results.Name: Ensure that the --DenyServiceExternalIPs is not set
Results.Description: This admission controller rejects all net-new usage of the Service field externalIPs

Results.Name: Ensure that the --kubelet-https argument is set to true
Results.Description: Use https for kubelet connections

Results.Name: Ensure that the --kubelet-client-certificate and --kubelet-client-key arguments are set as appropriate
Results.Description: Enable certificate based kubelet authentication

Results.Name: Ensure that the --kubelet-certificate-authority argument is set as appropriate
Results.Description: Verify kubelets certificate before establishing connection

Results.Name: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument is not set to AlwaysAllow
Results.Description: Do not always authorize all requests

Results.Name: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument includes Node
Results.Description: Restrict kubelet nodes to reading only objects associated with them

Results.Name: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument includes RBAC
Results.Description: Turn on Role Based Access Control

Results.Name: Ensure that the admission control plugin EventRateLimit is set
Results.Description: Limit the rate at which the API server accepts requests

Results.Name: Ensure that the admission control plugin AlwaysAdmit is not set
Results.Description: Do not allow all requests

Results.Name: Ensure that the admission control plugin AlwaysPullImages is set
Results.Description: Always pull images

Results.Name: Ensure that the admission control plugin SecurityContextDeny is set if PodSecurityPolicy is not used
Results.Description: The SecurityContextDeny admission controller can be used to deny pods which make use of some SecurityContext fields which could allow for privilege escalation in the cluster. This should be used where PodSecurityPolicy is not in place within the cluster

Results.Name: Ensure that the admission control plugin ServiceAccount is set
Results.Description: Automate service accounts management

Results.Name: Ensure that the admission control plugin NamespaceLifecycle is set
Results.Description: Reject creating objects in a namespace that is undergoing termination

Results.Name: Ensure that the admission control plugin NodeRestriction is set
Results.Description: Limit the Node and Pod objects that a kubelet could modify

Results.Name: Ensure that the --secure-port argument is not set to 0
Results.Description: Do not disable the secure port

Results.Name: Ensure that the --profiling argument is set to false
Results.Description: Disable profiling, if not needed

Results.Name: Ensure that the --audit-log-path argument is set
Results.Description: Enable auditing on the Kubernetes API Server and set the desired audit log path.

Results.Name: Ensure that the --audit-log-maxage argument is set to 30 or as appropriate
Results.Description: Retain the logs for at least 30 days or as appropriate

Results.Name: Ensure that the --audit-log-maxbackup argument is set to 10 or as appropriate
Results.Description: Retain 10 or an appropriate number of old log file

Results.Name: Ensure that the --audit-log-maxsize argument is set to 100 or as appropriate
Results.Description: Rotate log files on reaching 100 MB or as appropriate

Results.Name: Ensure that the --service-account-lookup argument is set to true
Results.Description: Validate service account before validating token

Results.Name: Ensure that the --service-account-key-file argument is set as appropriate
Results.Description: Explicitly set a service account public key file for service accounts on the apiserver

Results.Name: Ensure that the --etcd-certfile and --etcd-keyfile arguments are set as appropriate
Results.Description: etcd should be configured to make use of TLS encryption for client connections

Results.Name: Ensure that the --tls-cert-file and --tls-private-key-file arguments are set as appropriate
Results.Description: Setup TLS connection on the API server

Results.Name: Ensure that the --client-ca-file argument is set appropriate
Results.Description: Setup TLS connection on the API server

Results.Name: Ensure that the --etcd-cafile argument is set as appropriate
Results.Description: etcd should be configured to make use of TLS encryption for client connections.

Results.Name: Ensure that the --encryption-provider-config argument is set as appropriate
Results.Description: Encrypt etcd key-value store

Results.Name: Ensure that the --terminated-pod-gc-threshold argument is set as appropriate
Results.Description: Activate garbage collector on pod termination, as appropriate

Results.Name: Ensure that the --use-service-account-credentials argument is set to true
Results.Description: Use individual service account credentials for each controller

Results.Name: Ensure that the --service-account-private-key-file argument is set as appropriate
Results.Description: Explicitly set a service account private key file for service accounts on the controller manager

Results.Name: Ensure that the --root-ca-file argument is set as appropriate
Results.Description: Allow pods to verify the API servers serving certificate before establishing connections

Results.Name: Ensure that the RotateKubeletServerCertificate argument is set to true
Results.Description: Enable kubelet server certificate rotation on controller-manager

Results.Name: Ensure that the --bind-address argument is set to 127.0.0.1
Results.Description: Do not bind the scheduler service to non-loopback insecure addresses

Results.Name: Ensure that the --profiling argument is set to false
Results.Description: Disable profiling, if not needed

Results.Name: Ensure that the --bind-address argument is set to 127.0.0.1
Results.Description: Do not bind the scheduler service to non-loopback insecure addresses

Results.Name: Ensure that the --cert-file and --key-file arguments are set as appropriate
Results.Description: Configure TLS encryption for the etcd service

Results.Name: Ensure that the --client-cert-auth argument is set to true
Results.Description: Enable client authentication on etcd service

Results.Name: Ensure that the --auto-tls argument is not set to true
Results.Description: Do not use self-signed certificates for TLS

Results.Name: Ensure that the --peer-cert-file and --peer-key-file arguments are set as appropriate
Results.Description: etcd should be configured to make use of TLS encryption for peer connections.

Results.Name: Ensure that the --peer-client-cert-auth argument is set to true
Results.Description: etcd should be configured for peer authentication

Results.Name: Ensure that the --peer-auto-tls argument is not set to true
Results.Description: Do not use self-signed certificates for TLS

Results.Name: Client certificate authentication should not be used for users (Manual)
Results.Description: Kubernetes provides the option to use client certificates for user authentication. However as there is no way to revoke these certificates when a user leaves an organization or loses their credential, they are not suitable for this purpose

Results.Name: Ensure that a minimal audit policy is created (Manual)
Results.Description: Kubernetes can audit the details of requests made to the API server. The --audit- policy-file flag must be set for this logging to be enabled.

Results.Name: Ensure that the audit policy covers key security concerns (Manual)
Results.Description: Ensure that the audit policy created for the cluster covers key security concerns

Results.Name: Ensure that the kubelet service file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
Results.Description: Ensure that the kubelet service file has permissions of 600 or more restrictive.

Results.Name: Ensure that the kubelet service file ownership is set to root:root
Results.Description: Ensure that the kubelet service file ownership is set to root:root

Results.Name: If proxy kubeconfig file exists ensure permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
Results.Description: If kube-proxy is running, and if it is using a file-based kubeconfig file, ensure that the proxy kubeconfig file has permissions of 600 or more restrictive

Results.Name: If proxy kubeconfig file exists ensure ownership is set to root:root
Results.Description: If kube-proxy is running, ensure that the file ownership of its kubeconfig file is set to root:root

Results.Name: Ensure that the --kubeconfig kubelet.conf file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
Results.Description: Ensure that the kubelet.conf file has permissions of 600 or more restrictive

Results.Name: Ensure that the --kubeconfig kubelet.conf file ownership is set to root:root
Results.Description: Ensure that the kubelet.conf file ownership is set to root:root

Results.Name: Ensure that the certificate authorities file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
Results.Description: Ensure that the certificate authorities file has permissions of 600 or more restrictive

Results.Name: Ensure that the client certificate authorities file ownership is set to root:root
Results.Description: Ensure that the certificate authorities file ownership is set to root:root

Results.Name: If the kubelet config.yaml configuration file is being used validate permissions set to 600 or more restrictive
Results.Description: Ensure that if the kubelet refers to a configuration file with the --config argument, that file has permissions of 600 or more restrictive

Results.Name: If the kubelet config.yaml configuration file is being used validate file ownership is set to root:root
Results.Description: Ensure that if the kubelet refers to a configuration file with the --config argument, that file is owned by root:root

Results.Name: Ensure that the --anonymous-auth argument is set to false
Results.Description: Disable anonymous requests to the Kubelet server

Results.Name: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument is not set to AlwaysAllow
Results.Description: Do not allow all requests. Enable explicit authorization

Misconfigurations.Title: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument is not set to AlwaysAllow
Misconfigurations.Description: Do not allow all requests. Enable explicit authorization.
Misconfigurations.Message: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument is not set to AlwaysAllow
Misconfigurations.Resolution: edit Kubelet config and set authorization: mode to Webhook.

Results.Name: Ensure that the --client-ca-file argument is set as appropriate
Results.Description: Enable Kubelet authentication using certificates

Results.Name: Verify that the --read-only-port argument is set to 0
Results.Description: Disable the read-only port

Results.Name: Ensure that the --streaming-connection-idle-timeout argument is not set to 0
Results.Description: Do not disable timeouts on streaming connections

Results.Name: Ensure that the --protect-kernel-defaults argument is set to true
Results.Description: Protect tuned kernel parameters from overriding kubelet default kernel parameter values

Results.Name: Ensure that the --make-iptables-util-chains argument is set to true
Results.Description: Allow Kubelet to manage iptables

Results.Name: Ensure that the --hostname-override argument is not set
Results.Description: Do not override node hostnames

Results.Name: Ensure that the --event-qps argument is set to 0 or a level which ensures appropriate event capture
Results.Description: Security relevant information should be captured. The --event-qps flag on the Kubelet can be used to limit the rate at which events are gathered

Results.Name: Ensure that the --tls-cert-file and --tls-private-key-file arguments are set as appropriate
Results.Description: Setup TLS connection on the Kubelets

Results.Name: Ensure that the --rotate-certificates argument is not set to false
Results.Description: Enable kubelet client certificate rotation

Results.Name: Verify that the RotateKubeletServerCertificate argument is set to true
Results.Description: Enable kubelet server certificate rotation

Results.Name: Ensure that the Kubelet only makes use of Strong Cryptographic Ciphers
Results.Description: Ensure that the Kubelet is configured to only use strong cryptographic ciphers

Results.Name: Ensure that the cluster-admin role is only used where required
Results.Description: The RBAC role cluster-admin provides wide-ranging powers over the environment and should be used only where and when needed

Misconfigurations.Title: User with admin access
Misconfigurations.Description: Either cluster-admin or those granted powerful permissions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRoleBinding 'microk8s-admin' should not bind to roles ["cluster-admin", "admin", "edit"]

Results.Name: Minimize access to secrets
Results.Description: The Kubernetes API stores secrets, which may be service account tokens for the Kubernetes API or credentials used by workloads in the cluster

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage secrets
Misconfigurations.Description: Viewing secrets at the cluster-scope is akin to cluster-admin in most clusters as there are typically at least one service accounts (their token stored in a secret) bound to cluster-admin directly or a role/clusterrole that gives similar permissions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'prom-grafana-clusterrole' shouldn't have access to manage resource 'secrets'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Manage secrets are not allowed. Remove resource 'secrets' from cluster role

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage secrets
Misconfigurations.Description: Viewing secrets at the cluster-scope is akin to cluster-admin in most clusters as there are typically at least one service accounts (their token stored in a secret) bound to cluster-admin directly or a role/clusterrole that gives similar permissions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'prom-kube-prometheus-stack-operator' shouldn't have access to manage resource 'secrets'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Manage secrets are not allowed. Remove resource 'secrets' from cluster role

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage secrets
Misconfigurations.Description: Viewing secrets at the cluster-scope is akin to cluster-admin in most clusters as there are typically at least one service accounts (their token stored in a secret) bound to cluster-admin directly or a role/clusterrole that gives similar permissions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'prom-kube-state-metrics' shouldn't have access to manage resource 'secrets'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Manage secrets are not allowed. Remove resource 'secrets' from cluster role

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage secrets
Misconfigurations.Description: Viewing secrets at the cluster-scope is akin to cluster-admin in most clusters as there are typically at least one service accounts (their token stored in a secret) bound to cluster-admin directly or a role/clusterrole that gives similar permissions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'trivy-operator' shouldn't have access to manage resource 'secrets'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Manage secrets are not allowed. Remove resource 'secrets' from cluster role

Results.Name: Minimize wildcard use in Roles and ClusterRoles
Results.Description: Kubernetes Roles and ClusterRoles provide access to resources based on sets of objects and actions that can be taken on those objects. It is possible to set either of these to be the wildcard "*" which matches all items

Misconfigurations.Title: No wildcard verb roles
Misconfigurations.Description: Check whether role permits wildcard verb on specific resources
Misconfigurations.Message: Role permits wildcard verb on specific resources
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Create a role which does not permit wildcard verb on specific resources

Misconfigurations.Title: No wildcard verb roles
Misconfigurations.Description: Check whether role permits wildcard verb on specific resources
Misconfigurations.Message: Role permits wildcard verb on specific resources
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Create a role which does not permit wildcard verb on specific resources

Results.Name: Ensure that Service Account Tokens are only mounted where necessary
Results.Description: Service accounts tokens should not be mounted in pods except where the workload running in the pod explicitly needs to communicate with the API server

Results.Name: Limit use of the Bind, Impersonate and Escalate permissions in the Kubernetes cluster
Results.Description: Cluster roles and roles with the impersonate, bind or escalate permissions should not be granted unless strictly required

Results.Name: Minimize the admission of privileged containers
Results.Description: Do not generally permit containers to be run with the securityContext.privileged flag set to true

Misconfigurations.Title: Privileged
Misconfigurations.Description: Privileged containers share namespaces with the host system and do not offer any security. They should be used exclusively for system containers that require high privileges.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'calico-node' of DaemonSet 'calico-node' should set 'securityContext.privileged' to false

Misconfigurations.Title: Privileged
Misconfigurations.Description: Privileged containers share namespaces with the host system and do not offer any security. They should be used exclusively for system containers that require high privileges.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'install-cni' of DaemonSet 'calico-node' should set 'securityContext.privileged' to false

Misconfigurations.Description: Privileged containers share namespaces with the host system and do not offer any security. They should be used exclusively for system containers that require high privileges.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'upgrade-ipam' of DaemonSet 'calico-node' should set 'securityContext.privileged' to false

Misconfigurations.Title: Privileged

Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'scope-agent' of DaemonSet 'weave-scope-agent' should set 'securityContext.privileged' to false

Results.Name: Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host process ID namespace
Results.Description: Do not generally permit containers to be run with the hostPID flag set to true.

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host PID
Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the host’s PID namespace allows visibility on host processes, potentially leaking information such as environment variables and configuration.
Misconfigurations.Message: DaemonSet 'prom-prometheus-node-exporter' should not set 'spec.template.spec.hostPID' to true

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host PID
Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the host’s PID namespace allows visibility on host processes, potentially leaking information such as environment variables and configuration.
Misconfigurations.Message: DaemonSet 'weave-scope-agent' should not set 'spec.template.spec.hostPID' to true

Results.Name: Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host IPC namespace
Results.Description: Do not generally permit containers to be run with the hostIPC flag set to true

Results.Name: Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host network namespace
Results.Description: Do not generally permit containers to be run with the hostNetwork flag set to true

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host network
Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the host’s network namespace permits processes in the pod to communicate with processes bound to the host’s loopback adapter.
Misconfigurations.Message: DaemonSet 'calico-node' should not set 'spec.template.spec.hostNetwork' to true

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host network

Misconfigurations.Message: DaemonSet 'weave-scope-agent' should not set 'spec.template.spec.hostNetwork' to true

Results.Name: Minimize the admission of containers with the NET_RAW capability
Results.Description: Do not generally permit containers with the potentially dangerous NET_RAW capability

Misconfigurations.Title: Specific capabilities added
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Capabilities', capabilities beyond the default set must not be added.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'coredns' of Deployment 'coredns' should not set 'securityContext.capabilities.add'

Results.Name: Minimize the admission of containers with added capabilities
Results.Description: Do not generally permit containers with capabilities assigned beyond the default set

Results.Name: Minimize the admission of containers with capabilities assigned
Results.Description: Do not generally permit containers with capabilities

Misconfigurations.Title: Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all
Misconfigurations.Description: The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'owasp-juiceshop' of Deployment 'owasp-juiceshop' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'

Misconfigurations.Title: Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all
Misconfigurations.Description: The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution.

Results.Name: Minimize the admission of containers with capabilities assigned
Results.Description: Do not generally permit containers with capabilities

Results.Name: Minimize the admission of HostPath volumes
Results.Description: Do not generally admit containers which make use of hostPath volumes

Misconfigurations.Title: hostPath volumes mounted
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'HostPath Volumes', HostPath volumes must be forbidden.
Misconfigurations.Message: DaemonSet 'calico-node' should not set 'spec.template.volumes.hostPath'

Misconfigurations.Title: hostPath volumes mounted
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'HostPath Volumes', HostPath volumes must be forbidden.
Misconfigurations.Message: DaemonSet 'prom-prometheus-node-exporter' should not set 'spec.template.volumes.hostPath'

Misconfigurations.Title: hostPath volumes mounted
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'HostPath Volumes', HostPath volumes must be forbidden.
Misconfigurations.Message: DaemonSet 'weave-scope-agent' should not set 'spec.template.volumes.hostPath'

Misconfigurations.Title: hostPath volumes mounted
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'HostPath Volumes', HostPath volumes must be forbidden.
Misconfigurations.Message: Deployment 'weave-scope-cluster-agent' should not set 'spec.template.volumes.hostPath'

Results.Name: Minimize the admission of containers which use HostPorts
Results.Description: Do not generally permit containers which require the use of HostPorts

Results.Name: Ensure that the CNI in use supports Network Policies (Manual)
Results.Description: There are a variety of CNI plugins available for Kubernetes. If the CNI in use does not support Network Policies it may not be possible to effectively restrict traffic in the cluster

Results.Name: Ensure that all Namespaces have Network Policies defined
Results.Description: Use network policies to isolate traffic in your cluster network

Results.Name: Prefer using secrets as files over secrets as environment variables (Manual)
Results.Description: Kubernetes supports mounting secrets as data volumes or as environment variables. Minimize the use of environment variable secrets

Results.Name: Consider external secret storage (Manual)
Results.Description: Consider the use of an external secrets storage and management system, instead of using Kubernetes Secrets directly, if you have more complex secret management needs

Results.Name: Configure Image Provenance using ImagePolicyWebhook admission controller (Manual)
Results.Description: Configure Image Provenance for your deployment

Results.Name: Create administrative boundaries between resources using namespaces (Manual)
Results.Description: Use namespaces to isolate your Kubernetes objects

Results.Name: Ensure that the seccomp profile is set to docker/default in your pod definitions
Results.Description: Enable docker/default seccomp profile in your pod definitions

Misconfigurations.Title: Seccomp policies disabled
Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies.
Misconfigurations.Message: container "owasp-juiceshop" of deployment "owasp-juiceshop" in "juiceshop" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards

Misconfigurations.Resolution: Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards

Misconfigurations.Title: Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles.
Misconfigurations.Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'

Results.Name: The default namespace should not be used
Results.Description: Kubernetes provides a default namespace, where objects are placed if no namespace is specified for them
